pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

idioms.meaning: jack of all trades, master of none
a poor man has no time for leisure

idioms.reading: びんぼうにんのこだくさん

idioms.word: 稼ぐに追いつく貧乏なし
idioms.reading: かせぐにおいつくびんぼうなし
idioms.meaning: poverty is a stranger to industry

lessons.japanese: 金持ちは貧乏人を軽蔑しがちだ。
lessons.english: The rich are apt to look down upon the poor.

lessons.japanese: お金持ちは貧乏人を見下しがちである。
lessons.english: The rich are apt to look down upon the poor.

lessons.japanese: 金持ちは時に貧乏人を見下します。
lessons.english: The rich sometimes despise the poor.

lessons.japanese: 金持ちにも貧乏人と同じく悩みがある。
lessons.english: The rich have troubles as well as the poor.

lessons.japanese: 金持ちになるよりむしろ貧乏でいる方がいい。
lessons.english: I prefer being poor to being rich.

lessons.japanese: 金持ちか貧乏かによって、ものの見方が違うものだ。
lessons.english: We see things differently according to whether we are rich or poor.

lessons.japanese: お金とは縁がないんだ。つまり、貧乏ってこと。
lessons.english: Money and I are strangers; in other words, I am poor.

lessons.japanese: 願っただけで望みがかなうなら貧乏人も金持ちになれようが。
lessons.english: If wishes were horses, beggars might ride.

lessons.japanese: 金持ちか貧乏かによって、ものの見方が違うものだ。
lessons.english: We see things differently, according to whether we are rich or poor.

lessons.japanese: 稼ぐに追いつく貧乏なし。
lessons.english: No poverty can catch up with industry.

lessons.japanese: 稼ぎに追いつく貧乏なし。
lessons.english: Poverty is a stranger to industry.

lessons.japanese: 一生懸命働いたが、彼は相変わらず貧乏であった。
lessons.english: He remained poor despite being a hard worker.

lessons.japanese: もし今彼のお父さんがいなければ、彼は貧乏していることだろう。
lessons.english: If his father wasn't there, he'd be poor right now.

lessons.japanese: メアリーが子供の頃、彼女の家はとても貧乏だった。
lessons.english: When Mary was a child, her family was dirt poor.

lessons.japanese: なるほど彼は貧乏だが、満足している。
lessons.english: It is true that he is poor, but he is contented.
